thread.title_full: Thai domestic tourism drops by 2-3% in first half of 2015Travelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Thai domestic tourism drops by 2-3% in first half of 2015Travelandtourworld.com
text:
Thai domestic tourism drops by 2-3% in first half of 2015 Published on : Wednesday, August 26, 2015
Itâ€™s not all well for Thailand tourism! The recent bomb blasts and terror activities have prompted many countries to issue travel alerts to the once prosperous Asian tourist destination. In yet another blow to the Thai tourism, the Tourism Authority of Thailand has revealed that domestic tourism slowed down in the first half of this year.
The decline which has been pegged at 2-3 percent has been attributed to the cautious spending by tourists.
With the TAT aiming for THB800 billion in tourism earnings this year, the tourism authority is leaving no stone unturned to attract more tourism revenue.
The TAT plans launch promotional campaigns for the fourth quarter in cooperation with hotel operators, tourism agencies, low-cost airlines and other businesses.
The campaign is expected to start in October.
